name: useGetStockData
description: This function retrieves stock data from the Polygon.io API

stocksTicker.description: The ticker symbol of the stock/equity. Examples: APPL, ABT, MMM, ACN, ADBE

multiplier.description: The size of the timespan multiplier.

timespan.description: The size of the time window.

from.description: The start of the aggregate time window. Either a date with the format YYYY-MM-DD or a millisecond timestamp.

to.description: The end of the aggregate time window. Either a date with the format YYYY-MM-DD or a millisecond timestamp.

limit.description: Limits the number of base aggregates queried to create the aggregate results. Max 50000 and Default 5000.

ticker.description: The exchange symbol that this item is traded under.

adjusted.description: Whether or not this response was adjusted for splits.

queryCount.description: The number of aggregates (minute or day) used to generate the response.

request_id.description: A request id assigned by the server.

resultsCount.description: The total number of results for this request.

status.description: The status of this request's response.

c.description: The close price for the symbol in the given time period.

h.description: The highest price for the symbol in the given time period.

l.description: The lowest price for the symbol in the given time period.

n.description: The number of transactions in the aggregate window.

o.description: The open price for the symbol in the given time period.

otc.description: Whether or not this aggregate is for an OTC ticker. This field will be left off if false.

t.description: The Unix Msec timestamp for the start of the aggregate window.

v.description: The trading volume of the symbol in the given time period.

next_url.description: If present, this value can be used to fetch the next page of data.
